articles.content:
Enactment of Evil Law Opposed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Joint Action against the Enactment of the "Law on Combating Terrorism" reportedly held a press conference at the "National Assembly" building on November 19 to oppose the enactment of the evil law.
 The organization charged that the "law on combating terrorism" is a "law on strengthening the Intelligence Service" to increase its authority under the pretext of "combating terrorism." The organization demanded that the "National Assembly" immediately stop considering the "bill".    
 The organization warned in a press release that it would wage a struggle for resignation of the "minister of Intelligence Service" and disbandment of the oppressive tool in case the "Intelligence Service" forces the enactment of the "law on combating terrorism".

Treacherous "Agreement" Flayed
articles.content:
Treacherous "Agreement" Flayed 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and Peace on the Korean Peninsula of south Korea reportedly issued a statement on Nov. 18 in protest against the traitorous "agreement" reached at the South Korea-U.S. Annual Security Consultative Meeting.
 Accusing the south Korean ministry of defense of expressing a clear stand of supporting the U.S. unjust war of aggression and genocide, the statement dismissed this as a disgraceful act of admitting itself that young south Koreans are mercenaries for the U.S. 
 Recalling that in the "agreement" the two sides openly advocated the policy of military pressure towards the north, talking about the "need to maintain strong joint defence force to cope with the threat from the north", the statement said this betrayed the bellicose pro-U.S. submissive stand of the "Ministry of National Defense" as it favored the hostile policy pursued by the U.S. bellicose forces toward the north.    
 The nation will mete out a stern judgment to the United States keen to escalate the tensions and confrontation on the Korean peninsula and the "ministry" toeing its line going against the desire of the Koreans for independence, peace and reunification, the statement declared, calling for a continued struggle against such bellicose groups.

Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Hans Dietmar Schweisgut, new Austrian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 After receiving credentials the president had a talk with the ambassador.
